intro: Cuphea cyanea f. acuta, commonly known as the acute cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or purple flowers. The plant has upright, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its vibrant flower color and compact growth habit.
